trans-unit.source: Represents the collection of column headers in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control.

A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection> class stores the column headers that are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.View%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.View.Details>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection> stores <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects that define the text to display for a column as well as how the column header is displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control when displaying columns.
When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> displays columns, the items and their subitems are displayed in their own columns.
To specify which columns subitem data is displayed under, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection> class.
There are a number of ways to add column headers to the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method adds a single column header to the collection.

To add a number of column headers to the collection, you create an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects and pass it to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
If you want to insert a column header at a specific location in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method.

To remove column headers, you can use either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Remove%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method if you know where the column header is located in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Clear%2A> method allows you to remove all column headers from the collection instead of using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a single column header at a time.

In addition to methods and properties for adding and removing column headers, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection> also provides methods to find column headers in the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a column header is a member of the collection.

Once you know that the column header is located in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine where the column header is located in the collection.
Unexpected behavior can result when the combined width of all columns exceeds 32,768 pixels.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection"></xref> class.
You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> that owns this collection.
Creates and adds a column with the specified text to the collection.
The column header will be added to the end of the collection.
The text to display in the column header.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> with the specified text that was added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection"></xref>.
Adds an existing <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> to the collection.
You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method to add an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> to the collection.

If you want to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> at the time you add it to the collection, you can use the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.
When column headers are added, they are added to the end of the collection.
To insert a column header into the collection at a specific position, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method.
To add a set of column headers to the collection in a single operation, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> to add to the collection.
The zero-based index into the collection where the item was added.
Creates and adds a column with the specified text and width to the collection.
The column is added at the end of the collection.
The text of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> to add to the collection.
The width of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> to add to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> with the specified text and width that was added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection"></xref>.
Creates and adds a column with the specified text and key to the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The column is added at the end of the collection.
The key of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> to add to the collection.
The text of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> to add to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> with the specified key and text that was added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection"></xref>.
Adds a column header to the collection with specified text, width, and alignment settings.
You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> to add to the collection.
The text of the new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> added to the control is based on the `text` parameter.
This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method also allows you to specify the width of the column and the alignment of text in the column header.

If you have an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> that you want to add to the collection, use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method that accepts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> as its parameter.
When column headers are added, they are added to the end of the collection.
To insert a column header into the collection at a specific position, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method.
To add a set of column headers to the collection in a single operation, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The text to display in the column header.
The initial width of the column header.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment"></xref> values.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> that was created and added to the collection.
Creates and adds a column with the specified text, key, and width to the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The column is added at the end of the collection.
The key of the column header.
The text to display in the column header.
The initial width of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> with the given text, key, and width that was added to the collection.
Creates and adds a column with the specified key, aligned text, width, and image index to the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The column is added at the end of the collection.
The key of the column header.
The text to display in the column header.
The initial width of the column header.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment"></xref> values.
The index value of the image to display in the column.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> with the specified key, aligned text, width, and image index that has been added to the collection.
Creates and adds a column with the specified key, aligned text, width, and image key to the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The column is added at the end of the collection.
The key of the column header.
The text to display in the column header.
The initial width of the column header.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment"></xref> values.
The key value of the image to display in the column header.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> with the specified key, aligned text, width, and image key that has been added to the collection.
Adds an array of column headers to the collection.
You can use this method to reuse the column headers used in a different <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
If you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.

You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> at a specific position in the collection.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> objects to add to the collection.
Removes all column headers from the collection.
When you remove column headers from the collection, all information about the deleted column headers is lost.

To remove a single column header from the collection use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
Determines whether the specified column header is located in the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> is a member of the collection.

Once you know that the column header is in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the column header in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> representing the column header to locate in the collection.
`true` if the column header is contained in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Determines if a column with the specified key is contained in the collection.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If `key` is `null` or empty, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.ContainsKey%2A> returns `false.`
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The name of the column to search for.
`true` if a column with the specified name is contained in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of items in the collection.

This property enables you to determine the number of columns that are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.View%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.View.Details>.
You can then use this value when you are looping through the values of the collection and you need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.
The number of items in the collection.
Returns an enumerator to use to iterate through the column header collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that represents the column header collection.
Returns the index, within the collection, of the specified column header.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOf%2A> method enables you to determine the position of a column header in the collection.
To determine whether a column header is contained in the collection before calling this method, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Contains%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> representing the column header to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the column header's location in the collection.
If the column header is not located in the collection, the return value is -1.
Determines the index for a column with the specified key.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If `key` is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1`.`
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.
The name of the column to retrieve the index for.
The zero-based index for the first occurrence of the column with the specified name, if found; otherwise, -1.
Creates a new column header with the specified aligned text, key, width, and image key, and inserts the header into the collection at the specified index.
To add a column header without specifying a position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.
If you want to add an array of column headers to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The zero-based index location where the column header is inserted.
The name of the column header.
The text to display in the column header.
The initial width, in pixels, of the column header.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment"></xref> values.
The key of the image to display in the column header.
Creates a new column header with the specified aligned text, key, width, and image index, and inserts the header into the collection at the specified index.
To add a column header without specifying a position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.
If you want to add an array of column headers to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The zero-based index location where the column header is inserted.
The name of the column header.
The text to display in the column header.
The initial width, in pixels, of the column header.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment"></xref> values.
The index of the image to display in the column header.
Creates a new column header with the specified text, key, and width, and inserts the header into the collection at the specified index.
To add a column header without specifying a position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.
If you want to add an array of column headers to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The zero-based index location where the column header is inserted.
The name of the column header.
The text to display in the column header.
The initial width, in pixels, of the column header.
Creates a new column header and inserts it into the collection at the specified index.

This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method enables you to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> with specific column header text, width, and text alignment setting and insert it at a specific position in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
You can use this method if you want to insert a new column header into an existing collection of column headers.

If you want to use an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> and insert it at a specific position in the collection, use the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method.
To add a column header without specifying a specific position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.
If you want to add an array of column headers to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The zero-based index location where the column header is inserted.
The text to display in the column header.
The initial width of the column header.
Set to -1 to autosize the column header to the size of the largest subitem text in the column or -2 to autosize the column header to the size of the text of the column header.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment"></xref> values.
index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Creates a new column header with the specified text and key, and inserts the header into the collection at the specified index.
To add a column header without specifying a position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.
If you want to add an array of column headers to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The zero-based index location where the column header is inserted.
The name of the column header.
The text to display in the column header.
Creates a new column header with the specified text and initial width, and inserts the header into the collection at the specified index.
To add a column header without specifying a position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.
If you want to add an array of column headers to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The zero-based index location where the column header is inserted.
The text to display in the column header.
The initial width, in pixels, of the column header.
Inserts an existing column header into the collection at the specified index.

This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method enables you to insert an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> at a specific position in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.

If you want to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> and insert it at a specific position in the collection, use the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method.
To add a column header without specifying a specific position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.
If you want to add an array of column headers to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The zero-based index location where the column header is inserted.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> to insert into the collection.
index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Creates a new column header with the specified text, and inserts the header into the collection at the specified index.
To add a column header without specifying a position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.
If you want to add an array of column headers to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The zero-based index location where the column header is inserted.
The text to display in the column header.
index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
This property is always `false` for this collection.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the column header at the specified index within the collection.
You can use this method to obtain the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> stored at a specific location in the collection.
To determine the index of a specific column header in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
The index of the column header to retrieve from the collection.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> representing the column header located at the specified index within the collection.
index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Gets the column header with the specified key from the collection.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If `key` is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Item%2A> returns `null`.
The name of the column header to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> with the specified key.
Removes the specified column header from the collection.
When you remove a column header from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent column headers in the collection.
All information about the removed column header is deleted.
You can use this method to remove a specific column header from the collection by specifying the actual <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> to remove.
To specify the index of the column header to remove instead of the column header itself, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
To remove all column headers from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Clear%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> representing the column header to remove from the collection.
Removes the column header at the specified index within the collection.
When you remove a column header from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent column headers in the collection.
All information about the removed column header is deleted.
You can use this method to remove a specific column header from the collection by specifying the index of the column header to remove from the collection.
To specify the column header to remove instead of the index to the column header, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Remove%2A> method.
To remove all column headers from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The zero-based index of the column header to remove.
index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Removes the column with the specified key from the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The key comparison is not-case sensitive.
If `key` is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.RemoveByKey%2A> does not change the collection`.`
The name of the column to remove from the collection.

Copies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection"></xref> to an array, starting at a particular array index.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe).
`true` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection of controls.
The object used to synchronize the collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref>.
The zero-based index indicating the location of the object that was added to the collection
value is not a .
Determines whether the specified column header is located in the collection.
An object that represents the column header to locate in the collection.
`true` if the object is a column header that is contained in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the index, within the collection, of the specified column header.
An object that represents the column header to locate in the collection.
Inserts an existing column header into the collection at the specified index.
The zero-based index location where the column header is inserted.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> to insert into the collection.
index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
`false` in all cases.
Gets or sets the column header at the specified index within the collection.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> that represents the column header located at the specified index within the collection.
index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Removes the specified column header from the collection.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader"></xref> that represents the column header to remove from the collection.
